name: Hotel delle Province

reviews.title: Long way out
reviews.text: This hotel was adequate for our needs, but does require a lot of traveling on bus or metro to get to sights, shops etc. Nothing wrong with rooms or service - in fact staff were all very helpful and polite. Room fine, beds comfortable, shower room surprisingly good, but slightly disappointing buffet breakfast. The only major complaint is the distance from main tourist areas, but you get what you pay for... The concierge helped greatly with advising us to use Bus No.63 which runs from the nearby metro close to most major sights, and on to the Vatican. Never needed another bus! Distance from metro & bus to hotel is no problem.

reviews.title: Ok stop off
reviews.text: I stayed at the Millenium Hotel just for a long weekend during October. We found it quite difficult to initially find the hotel. Our first impression was "gosh, it does look different to the pictures," but we were just looking forward to lying down after a long journey in the rain. The porter that was sent to us to show us to our room, did not even offer to carry our luggage. Topped off by the fact he could speak very few words in English which was very difficult to communicate with him. However, the room and bathroom was very clean and contained all the neccessities in it that made the stay pleasant.

reviews.title: Great staff and service
reviews.text: The breakfast provided however, was an average continental breakfast. This was not complimented with the waitresses very rude, abrupt and arogant attitude. Which had by this time swayed our oppinion of the hotel completely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also known as Millenium hotel. This hotel wouldn't be a bad 3 stars, but if it is rated 4 stars you expect more than they can provide. The location is not good, it is far from Rome's main attractions and there are none restaurants close by. The breakfast is very good and it is included in the room rate. The service isn't good; we had to request them to check our room’s shower three times before getting it fixed. The room was very spacious though.
reviews.title: It should be a 3 star hotel, not 4

reviews.text: Before I left Hong Kong, I received an SMS from the hotel offering to arrange a limo from the airport. This they did at a reasonable price. On my arrival, the hotel staff were extremely courteous and helpful and I was soon comfortably ensconced in my room, the size of which afforded me a pleasant surprise.
reviews.title: Staff who care!

likes.disliked: — I only spent two nights there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, I was well looked after by the hotel staff, who provided me with a packed breakfast, as I had to depart before the hotel breakfast session started. The person who had just come on duty when I came downstairs for my bus was most concerned because he thought I would miss breakfast, and was rushing off to get me a packed breakfast when I told him I had one already.
reviews.title: Amazing value

likes.disliked: — the reviews we had read before hand which had put us off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After partaking of a delicious breakfast on my last morning, I duly checked out and was pleasantly surprised to receive various small gifts as souvenirs of my brief stay there. A very satisfying experience. Great value!
reviews.title: First visit to the Eternal City

likes.disliked: — distance from centre and standard of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel well in advance through lastminute website and got amazing value for money. £125 for 3 nights B&B double ensuite room with sky tv. Maybe not the best 4star but certainly a nice hotel which delivers everything it promises on the website. We were apprehensive before we went because of some negative reviews we had read but found all criticisms unfounded. The rooms were lovely, the breakfast was good, the staff were courteous and spoke good english. The area is not a bad area it is about a 20 min walk from Termini and on a major bus route so very easy to get to all the sights from. Also there are plenty of restaurants/pizzerias within a 2 min walk. A particularly good restaurant we went to was an Eritrean restaurant around the corner on the main road (Viale Ippocrate) called 'Sahara'. A really nice experience eating there the food was exceptional, very nice atmosphere, good service.
reviews.title: never a 4 star

description: Hotel delle Province is a comfortable, modern hotel located between Roma Termini and Roma Tiburtinarailway Stations. It is only few minutes away from the heart of the eternal city the stpo of underground BOLOGNA (line B) is only 400 meters from the hotel and with only 5 stops you are in the Colosseum or Spanish Steps.46 elegant rooms with all modern comfort, breakfast is served on the roof on 6 floor, WIFI free,a private garden, and a meeting room for 25/30 people.
